Installation¶

Installing Python and git(-lfs)¶

Python version support¶

Officially Python 3.6 and 3.7.

Installing git lfs¶

cimd-d and cimr integrator functionalities may use git large file storage (LFS). Install git and git-lfs to use these functionalities.

To install git-lfs on Ubuntu, run:

curl -s https://packagecloud.io/install/repositories/github/git-lfs/script.deb.sh
sudo apt-get install -y git git-lfs
git-lfs install

Alternatively, conda can be used to install git-lfs:

conda install -c conda-forge git-lfs && git lfs install

Installing cimr¶

cimr requires Python \(\ge\) 3.6. Miniconda or Anaconda are convenient options for scientific computing with Python. However, if a basic Python version has been installed, requirements.txt and setup.py files can be used to download specific packages required for cimr functions.

cimr can be installed using pip3:

pip3 install cimr

Or by cloning the git repository for the nightly builds:

git clone https://github.com/greenelab/cimr.git
cd cimr
python3 setup.py build
python3 setup.py install
